THE ACTUAL POST-MORTEM WE DON'T WANT TO WRITE

'We launched IonWave in Q1 2026 with high hopes. The product was good - customers 
who tried it loved it. But we couldn't crack customer acquisition. Our CAC hovered 
around $55-60, and despite testing dozens of creative angles, we couldn't get it 
below $45. 

At $55 CAC with $14 contribution margin, we were losing $41 per customer acquired. 
We burned through our initial capital in 6 months, and by Month 8, we had to pause 
ads entirely. We tried organic/content but couldn't generate enough volume.

By Month 10, we faced a choice: raise money at a bad valuation or shut down. We 
chose to shut down and return remaining capital.

Lessons: We should have validated CAC assumptions with smaller tests before 
committing capital. We should have had a clearer kill criteria and stuck to it 
at Month 3 instead of hoping things would improve.'

â€”The post-mortem we're trying to avoid writing.
